Key Match Events: Pakistan won by 6 wickets with 10 balls remaining.
Sri Lanka scored 344/9 in their innings.
Pakistan chased down the target of 345 in 48.2 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka hoped to end their World Cup losing streak against Pakistan, having lost all previous seven encounters.
Pakistan had a recent win against the Netherlands but showed some shaky moments.
Sri Lanka faced a tough match against South Africa but showed resilience in their chase.
Babar Azam mentioned that Hyderabad felt like home for Pakistan as they had been there for two weeks.
Fakhar Zaman's poor form was a concern for Pakistan, while Imam-ul-Haq also needed to prove his fitness with runs.
Charith Asalanka was highlighted as a key player for Sri Lanka, especially in the middle overs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Some cloud cover was expected in Hyderabad, but no rain.
The pitch was expected to be conducive to big scores, as seen in the New Zealand vs Netherlands match.
Imam-ul-Haq was close to reaching 3000 ODI runs, needing just nine more runs.
Sri Lanka had never beaten Pakistan in an ODI World Cup match before this game.
